an1.455-464:1: " … (455) develops the earthkasiṇa…[n.200] Akasiṇais an object, often a disk, used as a support for meditation. For example, the earthkasiṇais a disk of brown clay on which the meditator focuses to obtain an inner perception of earth. For full explanations, see Vism chaps. 4and 5.Ceaddsālokakasiṇa, the lightkasiṇa, which is not in Be and Ee.(456) develops the waterkasiṇa… (457) develops the firekasiṇa… (458) develops the airkasiṇa… (459) develops the bluekasiṇa… (460) develops the yellowkasiṇa… (46) develops the redkasiṇa… (462) develops the whitekasiṇa… (463) develops the spacekasiṇa… (464) develops the consciousnesskasiṇa… "
